1561528142_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
>If I tap to submit a new comment twice in rapid succession, which is by accident, two identical comments will be published simultaneously

When you do that you edit your JSON file by adding two comments, and then publishing the diff of your JSON file.

You can fill up your JSON file to the maximum size allowed by the ZeroNet site per user.

>It's a usability issue and should be fixed.

1561515103_1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4.body:
Regarding moderation, keep the textual content on your site, just hide it so people know what's being censored.

>I feel like this is a bad idea. ZeroNet was created to prevent censorship, and moderating what other's post seems like it will lead to ZN becoming like the rest of the clearnet

ZeroTalk is moderated as well, the owner can ban a user, edit comments.

> They could also have lists like Kaffie's spammer list for those who just want to click a button to block everyone on the list

I like that more and is effective, you can either be your own moderator by having your own lists or choose your moderator by choosing a list created by someone else.
